SENT.plain: A case of acquired haemophilia A presenting with extensive spontaneous bruising and anaemia is reported
The anaemia was due to myelodysplastic syndrome (FAB: refractory anaemia with ringed sideroblasts)
A factor-VII:C-specific inhibitor was also found
Prednisone and pyridoxine were given, and the inhibitor became undetectable after 4 weeks of therapy, but the abnormal ringed sideroblasts still persisted on repeated bone marrow biopsy
